org.micromanager.api

Class DataProcessor<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.micromanager.api.DataProcessor<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TaggedImageAnalyzer

    public abstract class DataProcessor<E>
extends java.lang.Thread
    A DataProcessor thread allows for on-the-fly modification of image data during acquisition. Inherit from this class and use the AcquisitionEngine functions addImageProcessor and removeImageProcessor to insert your code into the acquisition pipeline Note that this code will be invoked through its default (null) constructor If you use your own constructor, make sure that it accepts no arguments. If you need to initialize variables, do this in the makeConfigurationGUI method instead. That method is the first to be called.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataProcessor

        public DataProcessor()

    • Method Detail

      • makeConfigurationGUI

        public void makeConfigurationGUI()
        Generate and show the GUI needed to configure the DataProcessor.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Remove all GUI elements generated by makeConfigurationGUI(). If you override makeConfigurationGUI(), then you should also override this function.

      • setApp

        public void setApp(ScriptInterface gui)
        Receive the ScriptInterface object. Normally, it is not necessary to override this method. If overriding, make sure to call super.setApp().

      • run

        public void run()
        The run method that causes images to be processed. As DataProcessor extends java.lang.Thread, this method will be executed whenever DataProcessor.start() is called. Do not override this method (it should have been final).
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • requestStop

        public void requestStop()
        Request that the data processor stop processing. The current processing event will continue, but no others will be started. Do not override this method (it should have been final). Do not call this method from DataProcessor subclasses.

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Returns true if the DataProcessor has started up and objects are being processed as they arrive. Do not override this method (it should have been final).

      • setInput

        public void setInput(java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<E> input)
        Sets the input queue where objects to be processed are received by the DataProcessor. Do not override this method (it should have been final). This method is automatically called by the system to set up data processors.

      • setOutput

        public void setOutput(java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<E> output)
        Sets the output queue where objects that have been processed exit the DataProcessor. Do not override this method (it should have been final). This methods is automatically called by the system to set up data processors.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
        Turn the Processor on or off. Enabling and disabling the processor is handled automatically by the system. It is usually not necessary to override this method. If overriding, make sure to call super.setEnabled(isEnabled).

      • getIsEnabled

        public boolean getIsEnabled()
        Get whether or not this Processor is enabled. Do not override this method (it should have been final).
